info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 28 at 7:11PM CDT until May 28 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT FOR WEST CENTRAL HANSFORD AND EAST CENTRAL SHERMAN COUNTIES... At 711 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 16 miles west of Gruver, or 21 miles east of Stratford, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Hansford and east central Sherman Counties. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
